text: Gelanesaurus cochranae, Cochran's neusticurus, is a species of lizards in the family Gymnophthalmidae. It is found in Ecuador and Colombia. ==Etymology== The specific name, cochranae, was chosen in honor of American herpetologist Doris Mable Cochran.Beolens, Bo; Watkins, Michael; Grayson, Michael (2011). The Eponym Dictionary of Reptiles. Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press. xiii + 296 pp. . (Neusticurus cochranae, p. 55). ==References== cochranae Category:Reptiles described in 1931 Category:Taxa named by Charles Earle Burt Category:Taxa named by May Danheim Burt
title: Gelanesaurus cochranae
